conclusion: To determine when the object's velocity is at its maximum, we need to analyze the acceleration-time graph and understand how velocity changes with time.
The graph shows the acceleration of the object as a function of time.
The graph is a straight line with a positive slope, indicating that the object's acceleration is increasing.
The acceleration is positive from 0 to 1 second.
The acceleration is negative from 1 to 2 seconds.
The acceleration is positive again from 2 to 3 seconds.
The acceleration is negative from 3 to 4 seconds.
The velocity-time graph is the negative of the acceleration-time graph.
The velocity-time graph is a straight line with a negative slope, indicating that the object's velocity is decreasing.
The velocity is zero at 1 second.
The velocity is negative and increasing from 1 to 2 seconds.
The velocity is negative and decreasing from 2 to 3 seconds.
The velocity is zero at 3 seconds.
The velocity is negative and increasing from 3 to 4 seconds.
The velocity is at its maximum at 3 seconds.
